Title: Community Policy & Moderation Guidelines
Lyrics:
Genius is a place where everyone should feel comfortable to contribute knowledge and take part in thoughtful discussion. The forums engage Genius users beyond the music knowledge project, providing a space where contributors and music fans can discuss, debate, and continue to foster our growing online community. The Genius Moderation team leads the conversation, adding thoughtful contributions to community discussions as well as creating interesting topics of their own. They also make sure that the forums and song pages are a safe place for everyone.

We take abuse, harassment, hate speech, and baseless conspiracy theories seriously. Freedom of speech doesn't mean you get to upload or post whatever you want to Genius--we reserve the right to remove content, including uploaded songs or texts, that are purposefully created with the intention of harming marginalized people or groups, contain excessive hate speech, and/or contain harmful baseless conspiracy theories.

Reporting abuse, messaging a moderator or staff member, or tagging @genius-moderation will alert the moderation team to content and/or users that intentionally disregard these guidelines. Continued violation of the guidelines will result in disciplinary measures, which may ultimately lead to account suspension.

In order to better educate our community, Genius defines hate speech as language that is derogatory and/or discriminatory towards a person or group on the basis of attributes such as race, ethnicity, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, disability, sex, age, mental illness, socioeconomic class, or body type. This list is not exhaustive and may be updated from time to time.

→  Click here for a list of Community Staffers and Moderators.



Genius moderation uses a 3-strike penalty system. Upon a user's first offense, a member of the moderation team (mediators, moderators, and community staff members) will reach out with an initial warning and a link to the moderation guidelines. After the initial warning, further offenses will result in penalty strikes that include temporary bans of increasing length until the third strike which will result in a permanent ban.

Here's the process:


These offenses will earn the offender one strike.

Title: Skit - Considerazioni
Lyrics:
[Testo di "Skit - Considerazioni" ft. Roberto Saviano]

[Skit: Roberto Saviano]
Legalizzare non significa invitare tutti al consumo. Legalizzare non significa spingere tutti a farsi le canne. Al contrario, regolamentare, sottrarre all'illegalità. Se lo Stato imponesse alla cannabis la stessa imposta che impone al tabacco incasserebbe, in un anno, dai 6 agli 8 miliardi di euro. Direi agli scettici, legalizzate! Perché legalizzare significa sottrarre un mercato immenso alle organizzazioni criminali: toglieremmo dagli 8 agli 11 miliardi di euro alle organizzazioni. Questo danaro è usato dalle organizzazioni mafiose per corrompere la politica, l'amministrazione pubblica e a far collassare le nostre democrazie. Tutto questo significa che ci sottraggono diritti. Il Portogallo nel 2001 depenalizza la cannabis e in 15 anni diminuisce il consumo. L'Uruguay nel 2013 e il Colorado nel 2014 ne legalizzano il commercio a scopo ricreativo e anche qui il consumo diminuisce invece di aumentare. Ecco perché chi, con senso di responsabilità, sostiene la legalità e si auspica che il consumo di droghe diminuisca dovrebbe essere favorevole alla legalizzazione della cannabis; misura che toglie risorse alle organizzazioni criminali e che avrebbe, come effetto immediato, la diminuzione dei consumi come avvenuto nei Paesi che hanno avuto il coraggio di cambiare.

Title: Serenade Of The Bells
Lyrics:
In the sleepy town of San Juanita
There's a story that the padre tells
Of a gay senor and senorita
And the serenade of the bells
Seems they asked the padre for permission
To be married early in the spring
But their folks had just made one condition
That the mission bells had to ring
Everyone knew that the bells were broken

Then one night the village was astounded
For the bells began to chime
Still the bells are broken, goes the story
But if in your heart a true love dwells
They will chime for you in all it's glory
That's the serenade of the bells
